choices.F: Inclusion is generally better than exclusion.
choices.E: Try to use * with every search term.
choices.C: Include as many search terms as possible.
choices.G: Try to keep specific search terms.

discussion.content: B is correct, page 92
A does not make sense according to me. Because I think that data cannot be in 2 indexes at a time. Hence A will return no results.

discussion.content: Could someone point out where this is documented please.

B. Shift + Enter
You can also use Shift + Enter to force a new line
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.1/Search/Parsingsearches
Doesn't work. You need to use Ctrl + Shift + F

technically speaking, you can use both Ctrl + \ AND Shift + ENTER.

since Ctrl + \ is not in the answer options, then Shift + ENTER is the correct answer.

Formatting pipes into separate lines is done with Ctrl + \

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.1/Search/Parsingsearches

questions.question_text: Put query into separate lines where | (Pipes) are used by selecting following options.

discussion.content: A is Correct

Option A is true, but D is more specific about the minimum number of series.
Option B is not necessarily true. Line charts can handle both single and multiple series efficiently.
Option C restricts the number of columns to 3 or more, which is inaccurate. Even with 2 columns (representing two trends), a line chart is a good choice.

Typically, line or area charts represent multiple series. Line charts can also be used for a single data series, but area charts cannot.

A is correct

comments.content: The problem is that the word "optimal" isn't listed on their own document in any way. Not even a synonym of it. It states "typically" but that doesn't mean it's the best.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I would say due to the word "optimal", C is the answer as Line charts are best suited for multiple series. But it does say in Splunk docs that Line charts can be used for both single and multiple series. I think they phrase the question differently.

Selected Answer: A
Typically, line or area charts represent multiple series. Line charts can also be used for a single data series.
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.0/Viz/LineAreaCharts

Selected Answer: A

choices.A: Line charts are optimal for single and multiple series.
choices.D: Line charts are optimal for multiseries searches with at least 2 or more columns.
choices.C: Line charts are optimal for multiple series with 3 or more columns.
choices.B: Line charts are optimal for single series when using Fast mode.
